message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CV, cs.NE 

The paper presents an adaptive learning algorithm for handling concept drift in streaming data, which is a common problem in machine learning. The algorithm is generic and can be applied to a variety of supervised learning problems, indicating that it could fall under several sub-categories. However, given the focus on learning from data and the use of a base learner, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of drift detection and reactive states, which are common in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and data science (cs.DS). Additionally, the experiments involve image classification (cs.CV) and neural networks (cs.NE), which are also possible sub-categories.
